thread.title: Distilled's SearchLove San Diego 2015 speaker line up, topics and tips
thread.title_full: Distilled's SearchLove San Diego 2015 speaker line up, topics and tips

author: Julien Brandt, San Diego Online Marketing Examiner
title: Distilled's SearchLove San Diego 2015 speaker line up, topics and tips
text:
Distilled's SearchLove San Diego 2015 speaker line up, topics and tips Use your key for the next article SearchLove San Diego 2015 Image courtesy of Distilled 
Distilled’s annual SearchLove Event is fast approaching and I must admit that this years speaker line-up and topics have me sincerely intrigued. 
Not familiar with Distilled? Get acquainted with them here . They’re a tremendous resource in the digital marketing hemisphere, and the SearchLove events they put on are a true testament to this with the wealth of information and noteworthy speakers they bring to attendees, like myself. The networking opportunities are also a valuable bonus! 
This years speaker line-up of digital marketing guru’s are some the most forward-thinking. These individuals are carefully selected from various pockets that lie within this exciting yet complex world we’re all navigating, and brought together to offer attendees the latest and greatest on the most pressing hot topics and trends - some that you may be aware of, and some that you may not. 
SearchLove San Diego is a two day event that will be held this September 10th & 11th at the beautiful Paradise Point Resort in Mission Bay. We’re only days away so buy your tickets soon! 
Savings Tip: Moz recently posted a link to save $250. Use the code MOZSLSD152508 at checkout. 
Here’s a quick snapshot of the speaker lineup and topics they’re going to cover... 
Day 1 - Sept. 10th Tom Anthony, Distilled - “Five Fundamental Changes in Search” Will Critchlow Distilled - “Practical Advice for the Future of Search” Cindy Krum, MobileMoxie - “Mobile-first SEO and How to Prepare for the Next Mobilegeddon” Larry Kim, Wordstream - “The Top 10 Facebook & Twitter Advertising Hacks of All time” David Mihm, Moz - “Shiny Objects May Be Closer Than They Appear” Marli Mesbov, Mad*Pow - “Make Magic with Anticipatory Design” Mike Arnesen, UpBuild - “Seeing the Big Picture with End-to-End Optimization” Matthew Brown, Moz - “Not Your Father’s Google News” Chris Bennett, 97th Floor - “Never Lose Again” 
Day 2 - Sept 11th Kindra Hall, KindraHall.com - “The Secret of Irrisistible Marketing” Wil Reynolds, Seer Interactive - “Paid Search Strategies SEO’s Will Love” Ross Hudgens, Siege Media - “Data-Driven Content Marketing and Outreach” Jose Caballer, The Skool - “Continuous Alignment of Marketing Strategy (with Chris Do)” Chris Do, The Skool - “Continuous Alignment of Marketing Strategy (with Jose Caballer)” Joanna Lord, Porch - “The Future of Content Creation” Scott Edwards, Simple - “Optimizing for Delight” Angie Schottmuller, Interactive Artisan - “Holy Grail of On-Page Conversion Optimization” Rand Fishkin, Moz - “Search Ranking Factors in 2015: What Data, Opinions and Testing Reveal” 
Highlights I’m Looking Forward to Seeing at SearchLove San Diego 2015 
Whether anecdotal or prescriptive, all of the speakers will undoubtedly offer some extremely valuable information that can be applied to the overall digital strategies of any business. As the owner of an SEO driven agency, my personal focus will be on high-level topics that offer effective solutions and actionable tactics that can be applied in the more immediate future. 
Tom Anthony’s “Five Fundamental Changes in Search” peeks my interest. With some of the drastic changes we’ve recently experienced with regards to search, going back to the basics of what’s fundamental can be a huge benefit. 
Speaking of recent changes (or shake ups rather) it’s inevitable that Google’s recent algorithm shift toward the tailoring of search to the mobile consumer will be addressed in multiple speaker presentations, but Cindy Krum’s “Mobile-first SEO and How to Prepare for the Next Mobilegeddon” looks to provide a course of action that will keep us proactive and better prepared for these types of changes in the future. I'll be taking solid notes on this one! 
Content presentation topics never fail to glimmer and catch my attention. Joanna Lord’s, “The Future of Content Creation” aims to cover past and present approaches that worked, didn’t work, and even bring to light not only some new ideas, but also talk about other practices that may be making comeback. Hmmm? 
It’s a given that Moz’s Rand Fishkin will provide some extremely insightful information we’re all anxious to see with his presentation on “Search Ranking Factors in 2015: What Data, Opinions and Testing Reveal.” 
While I’ve highlighted the above four topics, that doesn’t negate my interest to see and hear all of the speakers at SearchLove San Diego. 
The event will be a focused collective of digital marketing at its most valuable. IMHO, it’s absolutely worth the investment! 
Some Tips for Attending SearchLove San Diego 
Have at least two members from your team attend, if possible. Why? You can both share in the note taking over the two day span of the conference. Also, one can focus more keenly on connecting live with social media while the other can listen, take notes, and perhaps live blog. 
Remember to bring boost packs for back-up battery life, power chords, fully charged devices, business cards, and maybe a small snack. 
If you’re planning to live tweet or ‘gram, make sure you follow the speakers and their associated businesses at the event so you can tag them and make connections. 
Lastly, make note of the event hashtags! #SearchLove 
I’ll be live tweeting at the event so please make sure to connect with me on Twitter @Julienbrandt 
Look forward to seeing you all there!
